prerequisites: Prerequisite: Mathematics 111 (completion or concurrent registration) and Physics 131 (completion or concurrent registration), 132, 141, 142, 143, 144 OR 145; PHYS 152L
summary: An introduction to principles of physics and their application to the environment. Topics include energy and its flows, engines, energy efficiency, energy usage and conservation in vehicles and buildings, the atmosphere, and climate change. Comfort with algebra and the integration and differentiation of elementary functions is assumed. Weekly laboratory work or field trips.
title: Introduction to Physics: Environmental Physics
